Job Title: Finance Manager

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, CESUSA, INC., is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

Job Title: Finance Manager - Receivables & Order to Cash Specialist

Location: Remote

Job Description:

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Finance Manager specializing in Receivables, Order to Cash, and Record to Report processes to join our dynamic finance team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in financial management, revenue cycle management, and a proven track record of optimizing and streamlining Order to Cash processes.

Key Responsibilities:

Receivables Management:Oversee and manage the company's accounts receivable function, including invoicing, billing, collections, and cash application.Monitor and analyze receivables aging reports to identify delinquent accounts, implement collection strategies, and minimize bad debts.Collaborate with sales, customer service, and operations teams to resolve billing discrepancies, disputes, and customer inquiries in a timely manner.Order to Cash (O2C) Process Optimization:Streamline and optimize the Order to Cash cycle to improve cash flow, reduce DSO (Days Sales Outstanding), and enhance operational efficiency.Implement best practices, standardize processes, and leverage technology solutions to automate and integrate O2C processes across the organization.Monitor key O2C metrics, analyze performance trends, and implement continuous improvement initiatives to drive process excellence and customer satisfaction.Record to Report (R2R) Process Management:Oversee and manage the Record to Report (R2R) process, including financial close, reconciliations, journal entries, and financial reporting.Ensure compliance with accounting policies, GAAP, and regulatory requirements.Coordinate and collaborate with cross-functional teams, including accounting, finance, tax, and audit, to ensure accurate and timely completion of the R2R process and financial reporting.Financial Analysis and Reporting:Prepare and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements, variance analysis, and management reports to support decision-making and strategic planning.Provide insights, recommendations, and actionable insights to senior management and stakeholders based on financial analysis and performance metrics.Team Leadership and Development:Lead, mentor, and develop the finance and accounting team, fostering a culture of collaboration, accountability, and continuous learning.Set clear performance expectations, provide regular feedback, and support the professional growth and development of team members.

Qualifications:

Bachelor s degree in finance, Accounting, or related field; MBA or CPA preferred.Minimum of 10+ years of progressive experience in finance management, with a focus on Receivables, Order to Cash, and Record to Report processes.Strong technical knowledge of accounting principles, financial analysis, and reporting.Expertise in financial systems, ERP platforms (e.g., SAP, Oracle), and advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel.Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills with a proven ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and senior leadership.

Detail-oriented, organized, and able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
